title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: The system should provide a warning message box asking users if they want to save their dirty files before shutting down. The message box should offer options like 'Yes' to save the file and continue with shutdown, 'No' to discard changes and continue with shutdown, and 'Cancel' to halt the shutdown process.
SR: Add functionality to display a dialog box when shutting down the computer, giving users the opportunity to save their unsaved files before proceeding with the shutdown.
